website_summaries.verdict: In a nutshell, the Wahweap is a force to be reckoned on the comfort front. That said, it also begs to be appreciated in the areas of design and weight. And this is without mention of its satisfyingly spacious forefoot zone yet.This hiker from Altra, however, has a lot of proving to do in the durability department. Nevertheless, while it lasts, the Wahweap is a trustworthy companion through approaches and low-grade climbs alike.
pros: Many users are astonished by the Altra Wahweap’s A-grade comfiness
This high-quality approach shoe is an aesthetic marvel, according to numerous sources
Some customers are very impressed with its roomy toe box
The Wahweap is incredibly light, several outdoor enthusiasts claim
Based on a small number of reports, this Altra offering is highly packable
Its amazing stickiness is the talk among a few customers
cons: Less than a handful of wearers find the Altra Wahweap’s construction flimsy at best
The shoe’s underfoot sensitivity could be better, says a moderately experienced hiker-slash-climber

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Update: I returned the first pair and got a replacement sent, but they aren't any better. The 2nd and 3rd photos are of the second pair, whereas the first photo is of the first pair. I'm going to return this pair as well and try ordering directly from Altra. Original: These shoes look and feel great, but on day 2, after only about 3 or 4 miles of walking, the sole has started coming off of the canvas. I'm very disappointed that these shoes are not as well made as I expected. I'm still enjoying my Superior 4s, but I will probably return these.
customer_reviews.author: zharon

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: No less than 5 people commented “nice shoes” the first day I wore them. They are a great casual shoe for kicking around town or a casual office environment. Fit like a glove and true to my normal size (12). The upper is super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Gearhed79

customer_reviews.title: OK with some issues
customer_reviews.text: Great minimalist shoe. Feels good. Two complaints: driving for long periods causes the heel to be uncomfortable, and durability is lacking...I have some separation of the lining inside, which hasn't caused me a problem yet but I've only had them a few months. Still overall a nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter L.

customer_reviews.title: Look nice, need short break-in period
customer_reviews.text: I love the look. The shoe seems sturdier than my other Altras, but there is a firmness around the top-ankle part of the shoe. It softened up after a few days. The foot shape doesn't feel quite as apparent as the solstice, One, or Tourin, but it's better than a standard shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for foot health and dressing up for days/nights out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for my dad because he needs a broader toe box for his foot health and he loves them. They look smart and are quite dapper for this type of shoe. He will usually wear these as a casual dress shoe when he is going to a semi-nice event and/or out for an evening. The bottom of the shoe is very flexible, which is great for one's foot health. Overall great shoe and holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Nila Bair

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoes! Fairly comfortable right out of the box, and are nearly broken-in after only 1 day walking around town. Outside toe are is a little tighter than other Altra shoes, but still very comfortable. My only dislike is the skeleton on the sole - its a little too gothic for my tastes and leaves skeletal foot prints on the sidewalk after walking through a puddle haha
customer_reviews.author: Fortis

customer_reviews.title: A must for casual wear.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes got to me quicker than expected. The company was quick, friendly and easy to work with. If you are looking for a typical Altra shoe, this isn't it. But it is still a great shoe. The toe box is your typical Altra comfortable toe box. But the comfort of the shoe isn't there, perhaps if you put your own insoles in. If you need arch support there is not much there. I do not need arch support, but I can feel the lack of support. Get some proper insoles if you want to use these to run or walk in. They are a fun casual shoe that gets many compliments for me.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Weird shoes, close fit, mostly comfy, very stiff
customer_reviews.text: Kinda weird shoes, fit like a glove (slightly tight in spots, not painfully so, unsure if they'll stretch), very stiff. Unsure what the use case really is yet, kinda strange to drive in, might be good approach shoes, especially for warm and dry climates. Hopefully they break in to be slightly softer, but still feel like they were molded around my feet. Visual details are cool, mix of wholesome hemp upper and edgy spooky skeleton sole.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pizzirani

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable moderately cushioned minimalistic shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable from day 1 (running 10km's with it), unlike other shoes by Altra, this one's over stack height is moderate so you are less 'elevated' and thus more stable, less prone to twist your ankle in rough terrain, and can run more minimalistic. With the right deal (like I had), its a real bargain. Only in 1 year of so I'll be able to provide a long-term review.
customer_reviews.author: Boaz Rymland

customer_reviews.title: Altra designers have some serious blind spots....
customer_reviews.text: Altra seems like a good company, they make a shoe with an anatomic toe-box, and zero drop. Great. But this is the second pair of different shoes I’ve purchased from them that had to be returned because the sole will NOT flex. Hey guys: no one cares if a shoe fits if you’re walking on a plank of wood.
customer_reviews.author: BoHenry

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Altra's running shoes for several years. I like the wide toe and the "Zero Drop" design. Thought I would try the Outdoor Running shoes. I wasn't disappointed. They are different than the support I get in the running shoes and it took a little time to adjust, but I am happy with them now.
customer_reviews.author: JVM

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and style. The minimalist-ness of this shoe is great. It’s an awesome everyday shoe but I think if you’re looking for a running shoe Altra has other models that might be more comfy. If you’re into running with almost no padding below your foot or on the sides then you might be into it. It is comfortable but I haven’t tested them on a long run yet and I’m skeptical of they will treat my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am a repeat customer! Great sneakers at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is super and o. Par with other Altra sneakers. I usually get size 12.5 without any problems and these are the same. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Converse
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and feel with elastic laces easy on and off, can’t imagine torturing my feet with regular “shoe” shaped shoes
customer_reviews.author: Bert Fatagain

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, not as cushy as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: I like the look. I normally order 4E widths, due to my flip-flop-wide feet, but I took a chance based on reviews indicating the shoes were OK for wide feet. They work for me. I usually run trails in fat, cushy trail runners, so out of the box these feel a bit hard for me. Time will tell after a few more test runs. For now, they're fine for everyday casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: John Eklund

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They fit a little tight in back at first, but have broken in nice. I get compliments almost every time I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: 🏂Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am very disspointed with this product. It is made in China, the quality of the cut and stiching is very poor, the sizing is way off. I have had to change them once to get the right size. I am a size 45 or 10.5 UK. I have had to order a US 12 which is UK 11 and they still tight. Very very dissappointing - I would not attempt to walk the Apalachian trail in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Fun shoes that are comfortable! They run a bit large (1/2 size).
customer_reviews.author: b. nolan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Again, a great fitting shoe and very comfortable but the durability of the upper was lacking. Shoe began to tear only after two-three weeks of wear.
customer_reviews.author: SMN

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, great quality, just didn't fit and didn't have time time to wait for another shipment .
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got hot and wide feet. These shoes are a dream come true. I’m bought a second color after my first pair!!
customer_reviews.author: John Day

customer_reviews.title: Good looking sturdy shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. Stiff the first 50 miles which I didn't mind. Now very comfy. Feel more sturdy than other altra shoes I own. Will likely buy again
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Altra
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit, I am not using as a performance shoe...used as a casual shoe. Altra has not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne J. Lowes

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable ridge behind the ball of the foot.
customer_reviews.text: There was an uncomfortable ridge behind the ball of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is nothing like the others I own. Hard to get on and not the quality of the others I have
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: These hurt my feet
customer_reviews.text: Really too small and not enough cushion. Really hurt my legs after a couple days
customer_reviews.author: calebandmelissa

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been running with Altra's for years, and this is a great shoe to just wear around.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD J VANGILDER

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like how it trains my foot how to land almost, while running. Very durable material and very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: levi strahan

customer_reviews.title: No padding or cushioning whatsoever and very uncomfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe zero padding and support..felt like wearing an uncomfortable flip flop that covered my entire foot..
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Little tight
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. I love the look and will be wearing these as my daily but not as a running shoe. They are a little smaller than the Altras I’m used to. They look and feel great fro everyday though in my opinion. Durability tbd...
customer_reviews.author: J Drama

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss!  YIKES!
customer_reviews.text: I wear Altra for orthopedic needs. This model has been discontinued and it's clear why it was never a big seller. The sole is smaller than the shoe on the instep cause your foot to roll into pronation! Horrible for your feet, knees and especially hips! Yikes! Returned in under 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Somecoolname

customer_reviews.title: you have no idea until you slip the bonds of a small toe box
customer_reviews.text: I ran into an Altra rep at an REI and immediately negatively judged the guy. He hung in there and showed me an anatomically correct foot and explained the importance of a wider toe box. I tried on a pair and was hooked. IF you have not purchased a pair of Altra's you are missing something big. I hike, run and do a lot of sports. HOWEVER I also wear biz casual clothes and these shoes cut it with crisp jeans or khakis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe, great construction. These definitely run small though. I currently have two other pairs of Altras (Lone Peak 4, Escalante 2) and have owned two other pairs. They normally have a wide toe box that accommodates my feet well, but this pair is just a bit short and narrow. Ordering a 12.5 instead.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuyInAK

product_meta.title: ALTRA mens ALM1963P Wahweap
product_meta.description: From gym to crag to trailhead to dinner, the Wahweap is ready to take you there. Named for a geological formation of the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument, it features a comfortable and soft 30% hemp upper which is both functional and sustainable. To add to this already awesome shoe, the outsole is "siped" for technical multi-surface traction and it features a climbing style wrapped toe for added function and durability.
